## Installation

You can install the development version of scIso from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("alihamraoui/scIso")
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

``` r
library(scIso)
## basic example code
```

What is special about using `README.Rmd` instead of just `README.md`?
You can include R chunks like so:

``` r
summary(cars)
#>      speed           dist       
#>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
#>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
#>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
#>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
#>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
#>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00
```

You’ll still need to render `README.Rmd` regularly, to keep `README.md`
up-to-date.
[`devtools::build_readme()`](https://devtools.r-lib.org/reference/build_rmd.html)
is handy for this. You could also use GitHub Actions to re-render
`README.Rmd` every time you push. An example workflow can be found here:
<https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples>.

You can also embed plots, for example:

![](reference/figures/README-pressure-1.png)

In that case, don’t forget to commit and push the resulting figure
files, so they display on GitHub and CRAN.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`FeaturePlotPI()`](https://alihamraoui.github.io/scIso/reference/FeaturePlotPI.md)
  : Visualize isoform percent inclusion (PI), ratios and distributions
  on embeddings
- [`IsoformBoxPlot()`](https://alihamraoui.github.io/scIso/reference/IsoformBoxPlot.md)
  : Boxplot of isoform expression across conditions
- [`IsoformPseudotimePlot()`](https://alihamraoui.github.io/scIso/reference/IsoformPseudotimePlot.md)
  : Plot isoform PI or expression along pseudotime with annotation bands
- [`computePHI()`](https://alihamraoui.github.io/scIso/reference/computePHI.md)
  : Compute Phi (ϕ) from a PI matrix
- [`computePIMatrix()`](https://alihamraoui.github.io/scIso/reference/computePIMatrix.md)
  : Compute PI (Percent Isoform) Matrix from Isoform Counts
- [`plotPIPHI()`](https://alihamraoui.github.io/scIso/reference/plotPIPHI.md)
  : Plot mean PI vs Phi for isoforms
